As part of the strong State plan, we have further increased and more directly targeted this effort, by assigning 50 additional police officers to the two new districts of Republican reconquest of La Courneuve and Saint-Ouen. Our plan also provides for the assignment of 100 additional judicial police officers to Seine-Saint-Denis by the end of 2022. This commitment will be kept and even exceeded. In fact, 125 additional OPJs will be operational in the department: 68 have been since 2020 and they will be reinforced with the qualification of 57 of their colleagues, from November 1st. Two new police stations will be built by 2025 in Aulnay-sous-Bois and Epinay-sur-Seine, and we have already completed the construction of a new police station in Saint-Denis, operational since October 2020. , as well as the relocation of the National Institute of Scientific Police this year. But as you know, I have spoken on this subject many times, if we must strengthen the number and the conditions of intervention of our internal security forces, the first priority is to improve the criminal justice response and the functioning of the public service of justice. Too long, ladies and gentlemen, for decades neglected to the point that the comparative statistics of the workforce and resources allocated to this public service with regard to the European countries around us place our country in a very unfavorable situation. I am proud, as Prime Minister, to have made the national representation vote for an unprecedented increase in the budget of the Ministry of Justice, by +8% in 2021 dear Olivier. And I am proud this year again, while tomorrow the draft budget will be presented to the Council of Ministers, to renew this exceptional effort to increase the justice budget by 8% in 2022. All our fellow citizens see it clearly, it the public justice service must be rearmed, justice must intervene within a reasonable time and render the decisions it must render. It is not a question of the intensity or severity of the sentence, it is quite simply a question of effectiveness. The number of court staff has been increased, with the creation of 12 additional magistrate posts, as well as 35 court clerks for all the courts in the department. We have also decided to begin work to extend the Bobigny judicial court to accommodate its future criminal center. More than 120 million euros invested directly in a building dedicated to justice. Delivery is scheduled for the end of 2025. While visiting it, I was particularly struck by the delays in the digitization of the major applications of this public service. These packets of bundles and paper that you had to step over to visit the criminal records of this great court. With the recovery plan, we are going to invest unprecedented means so that this digitization finally becomes a reality and improves the efficiency of the public service of justice. This is, as you have understood, one of the very first priorities of government action in terms of security. The sovereign state must assume its responsibilities and we must go where the chain is weakest. We will meet this challenge. I was talking about the Bobigny judicial court to tell you that it will be enhanced by the service of the Grand Paris Express, another major state project. This responsible investment will be enhanced by the service of the Grand Paris Express – another major State project. Indeed with its lines 14, 15, 16 and 17 and the prefecture station, the 40 municipalities of the department will have access to the renovated courthouse. Which gives me the opportunity to remind you that the Grand Paris express will be a great means of opening up Seine-Saint-Denis, by allowing, for example, a resident of Clichy-sous-Bois to access a basin of more than 3 million jobs in 45 minutes by public transport, that is to say an area 10 times greater than what it can do today in the same time. The ambitious timetable for the deployment of these new lines is now fixed and shared: we must stick to it. Line 14 will thus serve Saint-Denis in 2024, line 16 from Saint-Denis to Clichy-Montfermeil will see its first trains running in 2026, and it will reach Noisy-Champs in 2028. To enhance the attractiveness of Seine-Saint- Denis, the State must lead by example with its own agents. The decree which authorizes the famous loyalty bonus, which was particularly awaited, in order to anchor the civil servants in your department, came into force a year ago. The civil servants and agents who are, here, the first guarantors of the presence of the State in your department will receive a bonus of 10,000 euros after 5 years of service. I want civil servants and agents to come tomorrow to “make a career” in Seine-Saint-Denis. We will know the beneficiaries of this bonus after five years of service, the count of which began in October 2020, but its positive effects in terms of attractiveness are already perceptible. Another strong measure, the revaluation of the compensation scheme for civil servants working in the department at the level of the amounts paid to the central administration in Paris, will be completely completed by the end of the year. This reconquest will also be real estate. Thus, the work allowing the relocation of the sub-prefecture of Saint-Denis in a new building with remarkable heritage and architectural value has been launched. We are also going to rehabilitate the "Niemeyer" site in Saint-Denis, to accommodate the services of the DRIEETS in 2025. The former headquarters of the newspaper L'Humanité, will thus also make it possible to return the city to a real monument of late 20th century architecture. Finally, you will understand, I could not miss a subject that interests us all, namely the organization of the Olympic and Paralympic Games, which will put Seine-Saint-Denis at the center of the world in the summer of 2024. To prepare them, as you know, we have together raised more than 1.5 billion euros in public investment, including 1 billion from the State. Nearly 80% of these investments are located in Seine-Saint-Denis, because the Games were above all designed in terms of territorial heritage for the populations who need them most. SOLIDEO's environmental excellence strategy will put the department at the center of the ecological transition, with meticulous work on urban biodiversity and the quality of the carbon footprint, while designing high-performance buildings, adapted to the climate of 2050. existing sports facilities is also a major focus for residents of neighborhoods who today have six times less access to this type of equipment than the rest of the French population. As I recalled on the occasion of the inauguration of the Aulnay-sous-Bois swimming pool this summer, the Games will in particular make it possible to build and renovate 14 pools, in a department where one in two young people does not know swim. The Impact 2024 project, financed with more than 4 million euros over 2021, will fully benefit sports associations and integration actors in Seine-Saint-Denis. I know the territory, and in particular the departmental council of Seine-Saint-Denis fully invested in this subject. The Games must, it is a collective imperative, by their success and their influence will fully and directly benefit Seine-Saint-Denis and its inhabitants. I know it ladies and gentlemen, I have been long but there is so much to say... and above all I have not yet spoken about the main subject that brings us together. Because today we want to take a new decisive step against poverty and the development of integration. You know it is urgent. The poverty rate, with 28.6%, is, in the department, equal to twice the national average. The department also has 90,000 RSA beneficiaries at present, and all this social distress has been accentuated by the health crisis, as evidenced by the 7% growth in the number of RSA beneficiaries since 2020. Added to this is the difficulty of reintegrating, with 44% of beneficiaries registered for the allowance for more than 5 years, and an increasingly heavy financial burden of this expenditure: it was 358 million in 2012 and 551 million euros in 2020 in the accounts of the department. This gap between national solidarity expenditure and funding of the integration policy therefore affects our fellow citizens in Seine-Saint-Denis very directly. This is why we decided to carry out this experiment to recentralize the RSA allocation. This is not the first time the idea has been raised, it has been considered many times since the 2010s. Many have said it, many have promised it. But together, today, we do. I remind everyone here that Overseas already, an experiment of this nature is in progress, but with the 3DS law carried by Jacqueline GOURAULT, whose absence I apologize this morning, I decided to open the possibility of extending it to other departments and I indeed proposed to you very quickly when I took office, taking into account the specific and exceptional characteristics of your territory, that you engage in experimentation. And today, we are therefore going to act after discussions provided this new pact which will seal the relations between your department and the State. This is good, you said, for the finances of the department, Mr. President, I am delighted. But must I confess to you that this is not the first objective that we pursue? What is at stake, and you have reminded us, is to multiply the efforts for the integration of RSA beneficiaries in this department. Finally, let's go back to the origin of the RSA and the RMI for those who have known all this. Integration must once again become a pillar of your social policy. And I have no doubt, of course, that with all the actors here, you will be able to conduct a dynamic and effective policy with counterparts, in particular for the audiences that you have already identified as priorities, like the young people of 25, 30 years old or people with RSA for a long time. In reality, the choice which is that of the Government, I am not speaking of the substance this time, but of the moment, is anything but innocent. We see it, the economic recovery is here. It is, I want to believe, the fruit of our collective efforts, but also, allow me to say, of the measures taken by the Government since 2020. First of all to not let our economy down. Then, to promote its revival. The results are in. We will say this with modesty, of course, but without excessive self-flagellation. We have one of the highest economic growth rates of the euro zone countries. We have returned to the unemployment rate we had before the crisis, even though all the experts were announcing this prospect rather for the end of 2022. Through our joint action, we should have by the end of this year 2021, perhaps -be at the beginning of the year 2022, replenish the national wealth that was destroyed by the crisis. We should rejoice in all of this. But in the responsibilities that are mine, in the responsibilities that are yours, we must beware of rejoicing too long. The situation in our country, in your department, ladies and gentlemen, is still worrying in many respects. See even, since I am talking about professional integration, that one of the difficulties in this new school year is to fill the very many job offers that the economic recovery has generated. We all have to be on the bridge, because we believe in reintegration through training, through employment, through activity, through integration. What we saw this morning before joining you is a clear illustration of this. It is through integration, through work that we will restore dignity to as many of our fellow citizens as possible elsewhere, such as here in Seine-Saint-Denis, and I illustrate it here precisely because the step to climb is even greater and what we want is the meaning of what we are going to sign, to give you the means. Nor is the timing innocent. In a few days with Élisabeth BORNE, Minister in charge of Labour, we are going to announce a plan for strengthening, investing in human skills, training, the integration of job seekers, RSA recipients, it's your objective, but also active employees. Because beyond the cyclical effects of the crisis, everyone can clearly see that we are in a structural evolution of our economy, the ecological transition, of course, digitization, the emergence of new professions. We must put the package both for reasons of economic competitiveness and social integration on training and integration, the return to employment. This is one of the priorities for this fall. This is the meaning, dear Stéphane TROUSSEL, of the act that we are going to sign in a moment. In short, now that the One Youth Is One Solution plan has produced its effects, we must reach out to all those who are out of the way. Finally, it is a formula that brings together all our objectives at the moment. We need to reach out to those who are still reluctant to vaccinate. We must also seek out those who are unemployed, without qualifications. The dropouts, as they are called, you have to hang up on the Republic car. This is the goal we are pursuing together. Ladies and gentlemen, France is going through a difficult period in its history. The health crisis is still there. The economic, social, I was going to say societal crisis is also very present. As always in these circumstances, territories and fragile populations are affected as a priority and in these circumstances, you see, we can only hope to restore economic growth, renew social ties in the long term by relying on the actors of the territory, j come back to it. For this, we must talk to each other, respect each other, listen to each other. I see some, on the contrary, seeking to divide, to doubt, to add fuel to the fire. This is not the correct method. The Republic is the State that I represent before you with the members of the Government and its local representative. The State, because it is France and because it is our history, must play, it is my deep conviction, a major role, particularly in times of crisis and particularly for the territories and the populations which are the more in pain. And the State, this is what I came to tell you here this morning, is there by your side, by their side. Allow me to pay tribute to the prefect of Seine-Saint-Denis, to all the civil servants of the State, dear Jacques, in front of you, to the previous prefect, Jean-François LECLERC, whom you also cited in the preparation of the act that we are going to sign today but more generally in this affirmation of the presence of the State. But if the State must federate, unite, it must also know how to work with local authorities, their elected representatives and their services. This is a former mayor talking to you. The Republic, it is also decentralized and it is a force but it is not the communities against the State. These are not checks and balances that our fellow citizens expect. It is a renewed and unifying action on the ground. The Republic is also an exceptional associative fabric which is deployed everywhere, in all sectors, for culture, for sport, for integration, which are there to multiply in their own way and in an irreplaceable way the action of public institutions. To all of you, I want to say here again my gratitude and my gratitude. Because ultimately, being the Prime Minister of the territories means betting on trust. It is a key word, you know, in public life as well as private life, to restore it of course wherever it is damaged, and I am perfectly lucid on this subject. But also because these territories, whatever they are, you are living proof of this, are teeming with ideas, talents, energies, initiatives, which we absolutely must encourage, promote and make known. To win back the trust of the territories, we must trust the territories. And basically, what the strong State is doing in Seine-Saint-Denis as everywhere else in France, what this State must strive for, if I had to sum it up in one formula, Mr President, it is both to act step by step against all forms of separatism that can threaten the republican pact, and the recently enacted law will give us additional means, and at the same time boost our integration policies which are for some, it must admit, broken down. This is the whole meaning of the speech by Les Mureaux delivered by the President of the Republic. More than ever, the State must be up to this challenge. I have every confidence in the future and in the strength of the inhabitants of Seine-Saint-Denis and its representatives. Let's show them together that they can have confidence in us through concrete, precise actions, visible through commitments kept, through consideration that is as sincere as it is demanding. Thank you.

topics_FR: Journées nationales de France urbaine à Nantes
speeches_FR: Madame la Maire de Nantes, Présidente de France urbaine, Madame la Ministre, chère Jacqueline, Mesdames et Messieurs les parlementaires, Mesdames et Messieurs les Maires, Présidents de métropoles ou de structures intercommunales, membres de France urbaine, Monsieur le Préfet de région, Mesdames et Messieurs, Merci beaucoup, chère Johanna, de votre accueil ici à Nantes. Ce n'est pas la première fois que je viens dans cette ville, j'allais dire, dans ce département. J'y étais encore, c'était pour parler d'éolien en mer, il y a quelques jours à peine. Et je ne vous cache pas que c'est finalement quand je viens dans les territoires que je suis le plus heureux. D'ailleurs, il y a un record que je cherche à battre chaque jour, c'est celui du Premier ministre qui se déplace le plus. Pas parce que j'ai la bougeotte, mais parce que finalement, je suis moi-même toujours resté Maire, non ? Comme on dit : « Maire un jour, Maire toujours », et je sais bien que c'est dans les territoires que se passent les choses. Jean-Luc MOUDENC a raison, vous aussi, Johanna, dans tous les territoires. Vous appeliez à la fin de votre propos, Madame la Présidente, une nouvelle méthode, un nouveau contrat. Oserais-je vous dire que je m’efforce de les incarner l’une et l’autre ? D’abord parce que – je voudrais commencer par ça, vous l’avez dit tous les deux, vous le pensez beaucoup ici – nous sommes dans une période quand même particulière de notre histoire, une crise forte, inédite – je vais y revenir – et que j’ai quand même la faiblesse de penser, je me projette, voyez, dans 10 ans, dans 15 ans, ça me tracasse un peu, on se dit « bon, comment sera-t-on jugé ? » – par l’Histoire, pas par la justice… Et je me dis dans ces périodes-là il me semble quand même que nos concitoyens doivent apprécier qu’au-delà de nos convictions politiques, nos opinions, il y a des moments démocratiques pour trancher ça, il y en aura bientôt, il y en a d’ailleurs souvent, les Français doivent se dire quand même « il vaudrait mieux qu’on se serre les coudes ». C’est ce que l’on appelle les pouvoirs publics. Vous n'êtes pas sans savoir d'ailleurs qu’ils ne font pas toujours la différence entre la compétence municipale, celle de l'État, de la région, du département. Ils attendent de nous collectivement, oui, je le crois vraiment, profondément, qu'on travaille ensemble dans leur intérêt. Alors ça paraît une formule, mais dans les circonstances que nous traversons, la France, l'Europe, le monde, j'ai la conviction – je l'ai d'ailleurs dit dès ma prise de fonction – que c’est vraiment une nécessité. C'est une nécessité. Ce matin, vous voyez, cher Jean-Luc, comme un symbole, j’étais près de Bordeaux, un peu plus au sud, au congrès annuel de l'Association des Petites Villes de France (APVF). Et puis, ce n’est pas moi qui suis responsable du calendrier, me voici devant vous pour clôturer ce congrès de France urbaine. Rien ne serait pire, vous avez parfaitement raison, que d'opposer, là encore c'est une autre version de la nécessité ou de l'illustration du rassemblement : la France, elle est riche de tous ses territoires. Et quand je m'occupe ou quand je mets l'accent, avec Jacqueline et Joël GIRAUD, sur la ruralité, mais pour moi, je vais y revenir dans un instant, c'est comme quand je mets l'accent, et Dieu sait si je m'en occupe beaucoup, sur la politique de la ville. En fait, c'est la signification que le rôle de l'Etat, c'est de s'occuper surtout de celles et ceux parmi nos concitoyens – vous y avez fait allusion – ou parmi nos territoires, qui sont en souffrance et subissent des inégalités. C'est ça le rôle fondamental de l'État. Et des souffrances, des difficultés, il y en a partout. Mais de la force, du dynamisme, de la créativité, de l'inventivité, il y en a partout aussi. Mais avant, il nous faut faire, c'est un des objectifs poursuivis par ce Gouvernement, et notamment par Jacqueline GOURAULT, de la différenciation, de l'adaptation, de la déconcentration. Alors je commence par là où vous avez fini, bien sûr, c'est le sens de la politique gouvernementale demandée par le Président de la République qui va s'incarner par ce qui sera, je l'espère, un texte important de la mandature, la loi dite 4D, dont je confirme ici, puisque vous m'avez interrogé, qu'elle sera bien examinée et, je l'espère, votée d'ici la fin de la présente mandature. J'en profite pour dire que quand j'ai pris mes fonctions, elle était, comme on dit, dans les tuyaux, cette loi. Elle s'appelait 3D. Maintenant, c'est 3DS, 4D. Pourquoi ? Il y avait un quatrième « D » que je revendique, alors « D » c'était moche, je reconnais, le quatrième « D », au-delà de déconcentration, décentralisation, différenciation, j’avais, pour rester dans l'idée, j'avais appelé ça « décomplexification », mais je reconnais que c'est un peu complexe. Alors c'est devenu simplification, c'est plus simple. Mais il y a l'idée, effectivement, que je ne peux que partager pour y avoir tant et tant été confronté, qu’il y a les questions budgétaires, il y a tout ça, mais c'est vrai que les questions de procédure, les questions, enfin on le sait, je ne vais pas vous raconter la chanson ici, on a des records heureux peut-être au monde, mais le record des procédures de la complexité, ce n’est pas sans doute celui dont on doit être le plus fier. Il y a beaucoup de travail à faire. Il y a beaucoup de parlementaires ici. On a déjà voté des lois pour simplifier la loi ASAP, entre autres, récemment. Il faut encore et je le dis ici à France urbaine, puisque Jacqueline est là, le texte va arriver dans quelques semaines à l’Assemblée nationale, puisque comme vous le savez, il est passé au Sénat. Envoyez-nous des propositions pour nourrir ce quatrième volet. Je suis sûr que si je faisais une interrogation là dans la salle, on pourrait y passer l'après-midi. Toutes ne sont pas de niveau législatif, mais ne nous privons pas. Dans cette confiance, dans cette libération des territoires, il y a aussi un chantier, des procédures et de la réglementation qui entrave, et l'État donne tout son écho à tout cela. Je le dis, on va parler du plan de relance dans un moment, j'ai une formule que j'emploie souvent, le plan de relance qui se déploie très bien, y compris avec les métropoles. J'ai des projets qui sont bloqués par mes propres services. Je le dis aux préfets : allez, on y va, on fonce, ça se déploie bien. Il faut rappeler que c’est toujours des bonnes raisons : une fois, c'est l'architecte des Bâtiments de France ; une fois, c'est la direction départementale des territoires ; une autre fois, c'est les fouilles archéologiques, enfin des choses très légitimes. Mais enfin, à un moment donné, on ne comprend plus trop bien. Il faut accélérer la relance, il faut y aller, et puis, c'est celui-là même qui vous dit de le faire qui pourrait être considéré comme à l'origine des blocages. Donc nous avons un chantier considérable à faire sur ce terrain, vous avez raison. Mais, je veux vous dire, en vous adressant à cet effet mes remerciements, que ce que vous avez dit, tous les deux, ce que vous m’écrivez, ce que je vois partout, ça, c'est un point commun, le fait qu'il n'y a pas d'un côté les collectivités territoriales et de l'autre l'État, il faut travailler ensemble tout le temps, mais particulièrement en temps de crise. Soyez-en convaincus, j'y mets toute mon énergie. Et d'ailleurs, évidemment, puisque vous l'avez évoqué dans la crise sanitaire, vous savez, si on s'arrête là aussi en prenant un peu de champ, Dieu sait si c'est difficile, il y a des morts, il y a des malades, il y a des contestations, il y a des polémiques ; bon, mais si on regarde un peu en franchissant notre regard au-delà des frontières, notre pays dans la gestion de cette crise sanitaire, il reste encore beaucoup à faire. Il y a des territoires, je pense, aux territoires ultramarins qui sont actuellement encore dans une situation extrêmement préoccupante, mais, on peut passer notre temps à s'autoflageller. Si on regarde par rapport aux pays qui nous entourent, est-ce que la France est dans une situation catastrophique ? Je ne le crois pas. On a fait ensemble les choses du mieux possible. On a commis sûrement des erreurs. Il y a des gens qui savent tout ; ça, il y a des gens qui font la leçon en permanence. Ce n'est pas le rôle des élus, ce n'est pas leur habitude. Mais si on en est là, c'est parce qu'il y a eu cette formidable mobilisation. Et que le couple Maire-préfet, l'action conjointe de l'État et des collectivités territoriales et bien au-delà – vous avez cité les associations, les professionnels de santé, la Croix Rouge, les pompiers, enfin je ne vais pas énumérer tout le monde, vous connaissez ça par cœur – tout le monde s’est mis sur le pont. On peut ne parler que des gens qui râlent, qui contestent. C’est une réalité, bien sûr. Enfin, il ne faut pas oublier la grande résilience qu'a manifesté le peuple français face à cette crise. Oui, j'ai dû prendre des mesures difficiles. Il fallait, c'était nécessaire, en tout cas en mon âme et conscience. Les gens les ont appliquées, acceptées. Je veux bien qu'on parle, et c'est notre devoir, des résistances à la vaccination. On n'a pas fini le chemin, vous le savez. Et plus que jamais, je vais avoir besoin de vous. Enfin, il y a quand même une immense majorité qui s'est faite vacciner. Tout ça pour dire que, et je vous dis ma gratitude, ça a été une mobilisation nationale à laquelle France urbaine, puisque que je suis ce matin ici à Nantes avec vous, a apporté toute sa contribution. Du fond du cœur, merci. Et je le dis, ce n’est pas fini car vous voyez bien que les derniers mètres, les derniers kilomètres de la vaccination sont, sans surprise, les plus difficiles, et que ce n’est que par une action de proximité – on appelle ça « l’aller vers » – que nous allons pouvoir lever ces derniers obstacles ou, en tout cas, la plupart d’entre eux. Et je le dis bien sûr au passage, je l’ai répété à plusieurs reprises, je sais que cette implication formidable a eu aussi des conséquences sur vos charges. C'était une de vos demandes, Madame la Présidente. Je m'engage devant vous, bien sûr, à ce qu'elles puissent être prises en compte dans les soutiens de l'État, évidemment. Donc je redis ce matin aux élus de France urbaine : la bataille contre la crise sanitaire n'est pas terminée. Nous devons rester, bien entendu, non seulement vigilants et mobilisés. Vous connaissez par cœur les prochaines étapes, la vaccination des collégiens et des lycéens, la troisième dose dans les EHPAD, et plus généralement, pour celles et ceux de nos concitoyens âgés de plus de 65 ans. Mais avant tout, évidemment, celles et ceux, notamment les plus vulnérables de nos concitoyens, qui n'ont pas encore eu la première dose. Et souvent, vous le savez, – vous avez, Madame la Présidente, évoqué les questions de pauvreté – ces publics, il n'y a pas que des gens qui s'imaginent qu'on leur inocule la 5G avec le vaccin. Il y a aussi des gens qui sont en dehors du parcours de soins habituel, qui ne se vaccinent pas plus qu'ils ne se soignent en réalité. Façon de vous dire aussi que notre rôle, c'est de gérer tout ça le mieux possible. Évidemment, comment ne pas le faire main dans la main ? Je regrette au passage que l'on n'ait pas pu donner… enfin que le Conseil constitutionnel n'ait pas jugé conforme à la Constitution un certain nombre de moyens supplémentaires que nous souhaitions, on va chercher quand même, dans le cadre de l'État de droit, à renforcer les polices municipales pour les polices municipales. J’entends parfois : « ah bon, vous voulez créer un peu moins de policiers municipaux dans le cadre de ce contrat et plus d'éducateurs de rue, d'agents de prévention et de médiation » – que nous encourageons par ailleurs et que nous déployons dans les quartiers politiques de la ville ; pas de problème, aucun problème. Il y a des gens, je le dis, qui n'ont pas tout à fait la même vision de la sécurité que nous. C'est leur droit. Permettez-moi de vous exposer devant vous ici, la mienne, la nôtre. Il y a des gens qui font beaucoup de moulinets sur ce sujet. La création des 10 000 postes, elle est là, je m'assurais auprès de Madame la Maire de Nantes, et par ailleurs, Présidente de France urbaine, que le CSI, qu'elle a signé, pas avec moi directement, mais avec l'État, était bien suivi d'effet. C'est le hasard Monsieur le préfet, cette semaine sont arrivés les renforts prévus. Bon, ça tombe bien. Ça tombe bien, mais on va le faire partout. Ne croyez pas, on va le faire partout. Donc, vous en étiez convaincu, mais je vous le dis, si on est, comme je l'ai dit tout à l'heure, à la manœuvre avec vous sur la sécurité sanitaire, si on est, comme je vous le disais tout à l'heure, avec vous, à la manœuvre sur la relance économique et l'action contre le chômage et la pauvreté, je ne laisserai personne dire que nous ne sommes pas à la manœuvre, de manière extrêmement offensive avec la politique qui est la nôtre, dans le champ de l'action contre toutes les formes d'insécurité et de violence, à commencer par celles faites aux femmes, puisque vous savez que dans les statistiques de la violence, celles faites aux femmes sont celles qui ont subi la progression la plus forte. Je pourrais vous parler tout l'après-midi, Madame la Présidente, et je sais que vous apprécierez au plus haut point, je n'en doute pas, mais l'heure tourne. Mais enfin voyez-vous, je le disais en aparté à Johanna ROLLAND, j'ai préparé évidemment moi-même, comme toujours, mon intervention avec le soutien de ma complice Jacqueline. J'essaie toujours, à votre endroit comme à l'égard des autres, d'avoir quelque chose à vous dire parce que je sais qu'à vous en particulier, on ne vous la fait pas, les grandes envolées, des déclarations d'intention. J'ai connu ça, des fois, il faut le faire. Peut-être que vous-même d'ailleurs, parfois, vous vous y adonnez. Mais, mais l'heure du pays est suffisamment grave. Nous avons en commun quand même, finalement, de penser que la politique, voyez-vous, c'est quelque chose de sérieux, que c'est quelque chose de nécessaire. Plus que jamais, vous le voyez, on a besoin d'action collective. Plus que jamais, on a besoin d'être responsable, on a besoin de citoyens engagés. On peut être contre le passe sanitaire. On n'a pas le droit absolu de contaminer les autres. Cela ne marche pas comme ça la République, cela ne marche pas comme ça la société. Et vous êtes des élus de terrain, vous le savez tous les jours. Donc je suis venu une nouvelle fois devant vous, vous dire ma totale disponibilité à continuer ce travail de partenariat, mais surtout à vous apporter non pas des intentions d'amour, mais des preuves, car c'est beaucoup mieux. Et finalement, au moment où, j'en suis parfaitement conscient, la confiance de nos concitoyens – ça ne date pas d'aujourd'hui, je ne suis pas certain d'en être le seul exutoire – la confiance de nos concitoyens s'étiole, c'est finalement la seule réponse possible. Rechercher par tout moyen l'unité de la nation, travailler concrètement, dans la sincérité, à leur bénéfice, éviter les postures démagogiques et les formules faciles, et apporter la preuve de notre efficacité collective. Et là-dessus, qui que vous soyez, je sais pouvoir compter sur vous. Merci beaucoup.
topics_EN: National Days of Urban France in Nantes
speeches_EN: Madam Mayor of Nantes, President of Urban France, Madam Minister, dear Jacqueline, Ladies and gentlemen parliamentarians, Ladies and gentlemen Mayors, Presidents of metropolitan areas or inter-municipal structures, members of Urban France, Regional Prefect, Ladies and Gentlemen, Thank you very much, dear Johanna, for your welcome here in Nantes. It's not the first time I've come to this city, I was going to say, to this department. I was there again, it was to talk about offshore wind power, just a few days ago. And I don't hide from you that it's finally when I come to the territories that I'm the happiest. Besides, there is a record that I try to beat every day, it is that of the Prime Minister who travels the most. Not because I'm on the move, but because in the end, I myself always remained Mayor, right? As they say: "Once mayor, always mayor", and I know that it is in the territories that things happen. Jean-Luc MOUDENC is right, you too, Johanna, in all territories. At the end of your remarks, Madam President, you called for a new method, a new contract. Dare I tell you that I strive to embody both? Firstly because – I would like to start with that, you both said it, you think so a lot here – we are in a very special period in our history, a strong, unprecedented crisis – I will come back to this – and that I still have the weakness to think, I project myself, see, in 10 years, in 15 years, that bothers me a little, we say to ourselves “well, how will we be judged? – by history, not by justice… And I say to myself in these periods it seems to me all the same that our fellow citizens must appreciate that beyond our political convictions, our opinions, there are democratic moments to decide that, there will soon be some, there are often some, the French must say to themselves all the same “it would be better if we stick together”. This is called government. You are aware, moreover, that they do not always make the difference between municipal competence, that of the State, the region, the department. They expect us collectively, yes, I really, deeply believe that, to work together in their interest. So that seems like a formula, but in the circumstances that we are going through, France, Europe, the world, I am convinced – and I said this when I took office – that it is really a need. It is a necessity. This morning, you see, dear Jean-Luc, as a symbol, I was near Bordeaux, a little further south, at the annual congress of the Association of Small Towns of France (APVF). And then, I am not responsible for the calendar, here I am in front of you to close this congress of urban France. Nothing would be worse, you are perfectly right, than to oppose, here again it is another version of the necessity or the illustration of the gathering: France, it is rich in all its territories. And when I occupy myself or when I emphasize, with Jacqueline and Joël GIRAUD, rurality, but for me, I will come back to this in a moment, it's like when I emphasize, and God knows if I care a lot about it, about city politics. In fact, it is the meaning that the role of the State is to take care above all of those among our fellow citizens – you alluded to this – or among our territories, who are suffering and undergoing inequality. This is the fundamental role of the state. And suffering, difficulties, there are everywhere. But strength, dynamism, creativity, inventiveness, there are everywhere too. But first, we must do, it is one of the objectives pursued by this Government, and in particular by Jacqueline GOURAULT, differentiation, adaptation, deconcentration. So I start where you ended, of course, it is the direction of the government policy requested by the President of the Republic which will be embodied by what will, I hope, be an important text of the term of office , the so-called 4D law, which I confirm here, since you have questioned me, that it will be well examined and, I hope, passed by the end of this term of office. I take this opportunity to say that when I took office, it was, as they say, in the pipes, this law. It was called 3D. Now it's 3DS, 4D. For what ? There was a fourth "D" that I claim, so "D" was ugly, I recognize, the fourth "D", beyond deconcentration, decentralization, differentiation, I had, to stay in the idea , I called it “decomplexification”, but I admit that it is a bit complex. So it has become simplification, it is simpler. But there is the idea, indeed, which I can only agree with having been confronted with it so many times, that there are budgetary questions, there is all that, but it is true that procedural questions , the questions, finally we know, I'm not going to tell you the song here, we have happy records perhaps in the world, but the record for complexity procedures is probably not the one we should be the proudest. There is a lot of work to do. There are a lot of parliamentarians here. We have already passed laws to simplify the ASAP law, among other things, recently. We still need to and I say it here at Urban France, since Jacqueline is there, the text will arrive in a few weeks at the National Assembly, since as you know, it has passed to the Senate. Send us proposals to feed this fourth part. I'm sure if I was questioning out there in the building, we could spend the afternoon there. Not all of them are at the legislative level, but let's not deprive ourselves. In this confidence, in this liberation of the territories, there is also a construction site, procedures and regulations that hinder, and the State gives all of this its echo. I say it, we will talk about the recovery plan in a moment, I have a formula that I often use, the recovery plan which is unfolding very well, including with the metropolises. I have projects that are blocked by my own services. I tell the prefects: come on, let's go, let's go, it's going well. It should be remembered that it is always good reasons: once, it is the architect of the Buildings of France; once, it is the departmental directorate of territories; another time, it's archaeological excavations, well very legitimate things. But finally, at some point, we no longer understand too well. You have to speed up the recovery, you have to go for it, and then, it's the very person who tells you to do it who could be considered the cause of the blockages. So we have a lot of work to do in this area, you're right. But I want to tell you, by addressing my thanks to you for this purpose, that what you have said, both of you, what you write to me, what I see everywhere, that is a common point, the fact that there are not local authorities on one side and the State on the other, we have to work together all the time, but particularly in times of crisis. Be convinced, I put all my energy into it. And besides, obviously, since you mentioned it in the health crisis, you know, if we stop there too by taking a little space, God knows how difficult it is, there are deaths, there there are patients, there are disputes, there are controversies; good, but if we look a little by crossing our gaze beyond the borders, our country in the management of this health crisis, there is still a lot to do. There are territories, I think, in the overseas territories which are currently still in an extremely worrying situation, but we can spend our time flagellating ourselves. If we look at the countries around us, is France in a catastrophic situation? I do not believe that. We did things together as best we could. We certainly made mistakes. There are people who know everything; that, there are people who teach the lesson all the time. This is not the role of elected officials, it is not their habit. But if we are there, it is because there was this tremendous mobilization. And that the Mayor-Prefect couple, the joint action of the State and the local authorities and well beyond - you mentioned the associations, the health professionals, the Red Cross, the firefighters, finally I will not enumerate everyone, you know that by heart – everyone got on deck. We can only talk about people who complain, who dispute. It is a reality, of course. Finally, we must not forget the great resilience shown by the French people in the face of this crisis. Yes, I had to take difficult measures. It was necessary, it was necessary, at least in my soul and conscience. People applied them, accepted them. I'm willing to talk about, and it's our duty, resistance to vaccination. We haven't finished the road, you know that. And more than ever, I'm going to need you. Finally, there is still a huge majority who have been vaccinated. All that to say that, and I say my gratitude to you, it was a national mobilization to which Urban France, since I am here in Nantes this morning with you, has made its full contribution. From the bottom of my heart, thank you. And I say it, it's not over because you can clearly see that the last meters, the last kilometers of vaccination are, unsurprisingly, the most difficult, and that it is only through local action - we call it's “going towards” – that we're going to be able to remove these last obstacles or, in any case, most of them. And I say it of course in passing, I have repeated it several times, I know that this tremendous involvement also had consequences on your charges. It was one of your requests, Madam President. I make a commitment to you, of course, that they can be taken into account in state support, of course. So I say again this morning to the elected officials of urban France: the battle against the health crisis is not over. We must, of course, not only remain vigilant and mobilized. You know the next steps by heart, the vaccination of middle and high school students, the third dose in nursing homes, and more generally, for those of our fellow citizens over the age of 65. But above all, of course, those, especially the most vulnerable of our fellow citizens, who have not yet had the first dose. And often, as you know – you, Madam President, mentioned the issues of poverty – these audiences, there are not only people who imagine that they are inoculated with 5G with the vaccine. There are also people who are outside the usual care pathway, who do not get vaccinated any more than they actually treat themselves. Way to tell you also that our role is to manage all this as best as possible. Obviously, how not to do it hand in hand? But we must also draw all the structural consequences, in particular on our health system. Because that's what we're talking about for the future. This is why, I remind you, at the request of the President of the Republic, this Government and its majority have decided to reinvest massively in our healthcare system. Oh, you're going to tell me: "there's not enough". Finally, we have changed gear compared to previous years, we are not going to talk about spilled milk. We need to reinvest. This is the subject of Ségur in a few weeks. We have already started. Isn't it, Madam Mayor of Nantes? We are going to go out, deploy what is called the investment component of this Ségur de la santé. This will concern many of you… Finally, Johanna is right, your inhabitants, all this is done for them, of course. Let's never forget that. But I believe that is the role of the political leaders that we are. There is a crisis, we manage it as best we can. And we draw all the consequences for tomorrow. Nothing would be worse than giving our fellow citizens the idea that everything will start again as before. There are good things. There, for example, I am – I didn't say it when I arrived – perfectly happy to see you there, “finally a full room”. It's fun. It's true that visios, I'm like you, I'm starting to have dinner! Well, there are still the masks. Sorry. Despite the past. Good. Yes, it is not yet, I say it, completely normal again, it is not true, but it is better because we collectively give ourselves the means and because we remain vigilant. It's also better, Ladies and Gentlemen, Mayors and Presidents, in the economic field because there too, together, we were able to instil momentum and find the right tools. I claim before you, Ladies and Gentlemen Mayors, the policy that was chosen not – it was called whatever it takes – to let the French economy down. And there too, beyond all the polemics… You know, if what I say is not true, people realize it. We haven't let the economy down. Better, I say this too, than other countries and we are reaping the benefits today because, having not let it down, how to say, the economy is bouncing back even faster, even stronger. We made a recovery plan. We tried to multiply it. I was talking earlier, you were talking and I was talking about the contract. Forgive me but the contract is the meeting of two wills, an agreement. This is the legal translation of this method. I think that we have never - I try very hard - so much contractualized, concerted. And I say with the associations of elected officials, that I have contracted with all of them. And I decline it territory by territory on all fields. I spoke to you earlier about security and the integrated security contract, Madam, Sir. We signed a recovery agreement with urban France, but I did it with the ADF, I did it with other community associations. So this stimulus is absolutely necessary. And I say it there too. That doesn't mean everything is won. There are many problems: economic, social. You mentioned some, but despite everything, allow me to remind you that France today has one of the most dynamic recovery rates in Europe in the euro zone. I have been Prime Minister for 14 months. When I arrived, I was told: "Before we get back to the pre-crisis unemployment rate, it's not before the end of 2022. Before we rebuild the wealth, the GDP, that the crisis destroyed , it's not before 2024.” Well, but here we are, today, our problem is not that unemployment is exploding since it has already returned to the level of January 2020. You see, craftsmen, restaurateurs have to tell you, is to fill the jobs that are being created. I received the social partners for a long time, which I do constantly. That, too, is perfectly normal. I have set up social dialogue conferences. We don't agree on everything, but we always talk. We try to find solutions. And on the menu of these meetings, there was this major subject on which we are going to take a whole series of initiatives, there, starting this month. So we are on the move. And we are together as much as possible. This was also the meaning of the recovery agreement that we both signed. 10 billion, all the same, our objective, of which 6.5 can be mobilized around the recovery. I recall for those present, you know, a tool that you mentioned, the CRTE. Many have already been signed at the metropolitan level. It works very well everywhere in France, I tell you, everywhere in France. It allows us to strongly support investment. And I confirm to you moreover – it works so well – because of increases in raw materials, projects whose cost is increasing, what I said this morning in Small towns in France and which I repeat here in Urban France, that by redeployment, we are going to add an envelope of an additional 350 million euros for everyone's CRTEs. At the heart of these agreements, Madam President, Ladies and Gentlemen, there is the meeting of our priorities. You have yours. Jean-Luc MOUDENC said: “Who better than a Mayor, his municipal council, his metropolitan council, is placed to set the priorities of his territory? " Obviously. But the State also has its priorities and we must meet them, this is the meaning of the agreements. And among, of course, this meeting of wills, there is the ecological transition of our country. This leads me to mention a few subjects that you yourselves have mentioned: mobility, obviously, first of all. These are one of our challenges. It's not just in the metropolis that people cycle. Good, but bicycles, you've known that for a long time. We, too, decided to intervene within the framework of the recovery plan. We had put 150 million dedicated to the financing of cycling facilities. We made a fourth call for projects where we added 50 million more. But I had to fight, I say it in front of you, to obtain the deconcentration of this cycling plan. You know that it was still a little surprising that to finance a cycle path or a pedestrian bridge it was decided directly from Paris. I gladly concede. It had not escaped me before, now that I'm there, I said "we're going to deconcentrate the bike plan". See all the same, when you are Prime Minister you have victories, I assure you, quite significant... Beyond the bike, but the bike is not just anecdotal, I say it all the same, but as I know that I am dealing with convinced people I will not dwell on it, there is also public transport on its own site mentioned in previous interventions. The recovery plan, there too, the LOM law, well known to all of you, had developed envelopes, so let's be very precise, 1 billion 350 million euros of which, I am not opposing, I am describing, 700 million for Ile-de-France. There are many inhabitants in Ile-de-France, it is normal that there is a package in Ile-de-France. There were also things for Toulouse, I say, very large metropolis. But unsurprisingly, what did we see when we launched the calls for projects? That given this priority, I also say that to the President of GART since he is there, the projects have flourished. Especially since, as you recalled, the DURON report pointed out, there were losses of revenue, therefore an attack on self-financing. Beyond the safety net which, as you know, came to compensate for the loss of tax resources, which we have moreover renewed in 2021, following our agreement, dear Johanna, I have decided to open the mechanism of reimbursable advances to all the organizing authorities. This was a strong request from your association and I would like to tell you, or take this opportunity to tell you, that 574 million euros in repayable advances have already been requested by your cities. But, and answering if I followed your words correctly to the first of your requests to please you of course, but because – I claim it – it is a priority of the State which meets yours, it is happy , I decided that the famous initial call for projects of 450 million euros launched in December 2020 - we had added if you followed 50 million in July, it had been one of my first decisions - I decided that we would supplement this call for projects with an additional 400 million euros for the benefit of mobility in your territories. This is an extremely important point in daily life and I am going to ask my services to speed up these procedures as much as possible so that the winners can be designated as soon as possible and so that we can provide our fellow citizens with tangible proof of the priority that we agree on this. In terms of mobility, allow me to make a small development, we are still on the ecological transition, on low emission zones because I know that this is obviously a subject at the heart of your prerogatives. I haven't said it until now, it gives me the opportunity to say it, here again I'm not opposing the municipality and the intermunicipality. I was Mayor and President of EPCI for 12 years. So all that, it is necessary at all costs that the intermunicipality is the municipality differently and that it does better what the member municipalities cannot do. It is a model to be constantly invented, it must be achieved. And so I say it anyway, we support the intermunicipal metropolitan fact, let it be very clear. Moreover, the CRTEs to which I alluded earlier, as you know, that does not prevent municipal projects from emerging there, but we have chosen, I have asked the representatives of the State to choose the intermunicipal database to sign them. It is also a sign. It is not, once again it is certainly not, and especially not in the spirit that is mine, an act against the communes, quite the contrary. But it is simply taking the reality of living areas, again, as you invite us to do. Starting from the reality of the needs, of the needs of the populations, including the EPZs, it is also this framework, as you well know, that they favour. As you know that the definition of these zones and the traffic rules that apply there are up to you and that is a good thing. But here too, we have to work together. And everyone has to assume their responsibilities. You have to go there, to put it in direct terms, even if it is not simple. I remind you that in these areas we have increased the conversion premium if the community also commits. Some did, not all; so I'm making a call. Solutions exist, as you also know, to help the most modest households. It is a way of saying that this transition must necessarily be supported. I will come back to it with MaPrimRénov’. We must also, I know, put in place and deploy means of control and sanction with in particular, as you requested, an automatic speed camera system. We now have a clear timetable on this subject, and the Ministers are fully mobilized. These first radars must be deployed in the voluntary territories from January 1, 2023, with the aim of generalizing them very quickly. So, I take advantage of my presence this morning before you on this very concrete subject of EPZs, the extreme difficulty of which I in no way underestimate, the extreme difficulty for all of us. But with pragmatism and determination, we must move forward together as we are doing for MaPrimRénov' that I mentioned earlier. It's a success, I was saying it considerable, so far, we are on a national flow of 15,000 requests for help per week, which could lead us to 800 by the end of this year 2021. 000 households affected by this system, whose energy renovation challenges you know perfectly well. This is why, to go even further and with a view to simplifying aid for renovation, this is a subject we also discussed, the "Living better serenity" scheme will very soon integrate MaPrimRénov'. And I also confirm to you today our will, in any case the possibility of delegating to the communities which wish it the envelopes devoted to the ambitious renovations intended for the housing of modest and very modest households. In the same way, it is more institutional, but I know that you are keen on it, I asked the Minister for Ecological Transition to extend the participation of Urban France to certain operator organizations. I am thinking of Ademe, Anah, the National Air Council, the National Circular Economy Council; all this was necessary. It's done. And we should be happy about that. You have – I think it's Jean-Luc since I'm talking about housing – spoken, I have just done so, from the angle of the ecological transition, of production. And there too, whatever the origins of the difficulties, we all have to go back on the offensive in this matter collectively. As you know, I entrusted a President of metropolitan France, François REBSAMEN, with the task of making proposals to us within the framework of a commission of experts. A number of you, and I thank them, sat on it. This commission will soon be giving me these recommendations. I hope that we will be able to follow most of them and from the finance law for 2022, because there is urgency, as you know, between the crisis and different elements. In 2017, there were, there were 240,000 collective dwellings authorized in the metropolises, large cities and main agglomerations of the country. And since then, the number of permits has plummeted. Since 2019, we have been below the bar of 180,000 collective housing authorized in tense territories and you know what that entails, I'm not going to play music for you, in terms of price and therefore consequences on the purchasing power of our fellow citizens. So the Mayor of Toulouse, he said to me: “yes, but be careful, there must not be contradictory objectives. In other words, how to reconcile the essential action against artificialisation, let's all reread, we are not going to do it there, the text of the law. It's not a clean cleaver. We arrange. Land take is progressing every year 4 times faster than the population. Okay, obviously, you have to be able to accommodate people. We can say to ourselves: we need land for that. Yes, but there, the account is not there. We are the opposite. Good. So something has to be done about that. The legislator has taken it up and I would like to say that one of the ways, obviously not the only one in your territories, of reconciling what appears to be a contradiction, is first of all to commit , as you do, very actively in the rehabilitation of wasteland. Well, the wasteland fund, you know, it works very well. We had devoted 300 million euros to it in the recovery plan. I increased them a few months ago to 650 and you have no doubt noted it, the President of the Republic has decided to make this fund permanent because it seems to us precisely that it should allow, it is a tool among others, to respond to the need to build, to obviously requalify urban centers, to provide housing without resorting to artificialization. This reconquest of urban centers, I have already alluded to it, you spoke of poverty, we are talking about housing. I would like to insist before you, ladies and gentlemen elected officials, on the policy of the city. City policy, I had, or rather the President of the Republic had been questioned by a certain number of you, you remember, a few months ago. At the request of the Head of State, dear Jacqueline, I took the subject head-on personally because I believe that the situations that I observe, which I obviously knew before becoming Prime Minister, but which I have noticed even better since then, presuppose a very strong investment or reinvestment by the State at your side, obviously, once again. I chaired an extremely important inter-ministerial committee for cities on 29 January last, following this call, and we released extremely strong resources, I won't go into detail, but you know, particularly for the ANRU, to direct credits from France Relance. I had been asked for 1 billion, we have 1 billion 100 million, for the benefit of city policy, to increase funding, for example on sports equipment in these districts. In any case, I am talking about the credits of the National Sports Agency. It is an extremely important subject, as you know. Behind, there is integration and republican cohesion. I follow the commitments made. I will be going soon, as I do every 3 or 4 months, with my Ministers, to see how things are going on the ground, how the actions we have decided are being deployed, and if I say so in front of you, this is not simply to teach government action, but it is obviously to tell you that on this subject, as on so many others, I obviously need your involvement, and I would like another times greet her. You spoke of young people, dear Johanna, in your intervention. Poverty in general, of young people in particular. There too, it is a very strong concern of the State. I still want to remind you here and tell you again that the “1 young person, 1 solution” plan has produced quite significant results. I experienced, you too, the previous crisis of 2008-2010, +31% youth unemployment. And they are always the first victims of crisis situations. Thanks to the means that we have deployed, which you have also relayed, the employment rate for young people is now very favorably oriented, the unemployment rate for young people is lower, as I speak, than it was in January 2020. Should we be satisfied with this situation? Certainly not. Because, if we cross our borders again, we see that the number of young people in France who are unemployed, without any training, without qualifications is, as a percentage, much higher, even today, than it is in many of countries around us. The President of the Republic has asked, and we are working on it with Elisabeth BORNE, to seek out these young people to put them back into activity and integration to deploy new means. I know the proposals that you mentioned from Urban France. And I tell you that we are going to work together with Elisabeth BORNE within the framework of our objectives. The frankness, the respect that I owe you, to you as to the others, leads me to tell you that our intention is clearly not to create a young RSA. I say it and I assume it. Our objective is to lead as many young people as possible towards training or employment and to remove all possible and imaginable obstacles by mobilizing the public employment and integration service to lead them on this journey. And all initiatives in this context will obviously be welcome. The matter is too serious, too important for us to imagine working alone and having the right solutions in our own corner. It is a national cause, at a time, as you know, moreover, when, in the context of this health crisis, young people have been particularly affected. I would finally like – I would have so many things to say, but the clock is ticking – to talk to you about security. Because, we know very well, in the context of our work, on transport, on economic development, on youth, in support of the skills that are yours, without mentioning those that are ours, those of the 'State. Subject obviously oh so important and for which I would like to recall the orientations and especially, the actions of my Government. There is the health crisis, there is health security, there is economic recovery, employment, poverty, these are priorities. And so is safety. Look at the legislative news of the Parliament on this subject, it is particularly provided. Here too, we work with you. Here too, we work with you because we know that security is first and foremost the business of the State, but everyone's business. The state does not shirk its responsibilities. We will have created – the finance bill for 2022 will bear witness to this – 10,000 additional police and gendarmes during the present five-year period. For those who are in love with numbers, let them go back in time and explain to me who says better, beyond formulas. That's facts. Your servant, because this effort concerns the whole of the five-year term, your servant, for his part, as soon as I made the General Policy Statement to Parliament, wished to emphasize a major element: the public service of justice, at the heart, at the heart of sovereign activity. Which elected official, which mayor here present has not, I was going to say which citizen, been able to see that if the police services, the gendarmerie, could do their job, even if, as I said, they need to be reinforced, reinforced, the penal suite was not always there? Let us be clear, the proportionate, appropriate criminal prosecution, within the framework of a republican state of law from which we must never deviate. So why this situation? You all know it well, that you always see it, it is certainly not by hitting the judges that we will bring the solution. The truth here too comes from international comparisons: for decades, the State, the first responsible, has not provided the public service of justice with the necessary means. It's like that. We have much lower figures than in Germany, Italy, Spain, finally we are very badly positioned. We must resume the offensive. French justice is less digitized than that of many democratic states around us. Go, as I do, visit transplants, for example. The real estate portfolio of the Ministry of Justice is behind schedule. So we go all out: +8% of the budget of the Ministry of Justice in 2021. Unprecedented for 40 years. Actions are needed. The finance bill which will be submitted to the Council of Ministers in a few days will provide for a further increase, if Parliament is willing to vote for it, in the budget of the Ministry of Justice: another +8%. We are setting up the continuity of the necessary restoration of the efficiency of the public service of justice. When I meet the magistrates, and I often do, I tell them "I am not the man who is going or who is seeking to modify for the 50th time the Code of Criminal Procedure, the Code of Civil Procedure, the Penal Code. All this is moved often. I am the steward. I want it to work, I want us to have results. Our fellow citizens are obviously expecting them, it won't come overnight. We are on very emotional subjects on which many surf, on which many play very recklessly. I say it here. We are attacking the roots of the subject. And tackling the roots of the subject also means doing it transversally, and I come to the integrated security contract. You have two lucky guys there who have already signed with the State. The first, I signed it with Mr. MOUDENC who, at the time, chaired Urban France. It's symbolic, not because I like Toulouse, because I like all the other towns and cities in France the same. But when I came, it may not have escaped you that this contract, I signed it, there was of course the Minister of the Interior. Classic and oh so essential approach to safety that we are going to extend in the case of a Beauvau. But there was the Keeper of the Seals, an illustration of what I have just explained to you. And then there was the Minister of National Education because we consider and we claim that acting against insecurity is not limited to the repressive domain, even if we cannot compromise with respect for republican law. You are well aware, all of you who are experienced elected officials in the field, that education and prevention are all explanatory factors. When – and I claim this in front of you – we split classes in priority education areas. We act in the interests of children of course, and we contribute to the prevention of phenomena of violence and insecurity. We must therefore have, on these extremely complex subjects, the broadest possible approach with the local authorities. And I try, it's not always easy, to promote the metropolitan fact because, obviously, crime has no borders in these areas. And I sometimes say to elected officials, when we discuss: we want you to develop, we will help you, video surveillance – video surveillance is not a panacea but it is very useful. We wanted you to increase your municipal police force. I regret in passing that we were not able to give...well, that the Constitutional Council did not consider a certain number of additional means that we wanted to be in conformity with the Constitution, we will seek all the same, within the framework of the rule of law, to strengthen the municipal police for the municipal police. I sometimes hear: "oh well, you want to create a few fewer municipal police officers within the framework of this contract and more street educators, prevention and mediation agents" - which we also encourage and which we deploy in the political districts of the city; no problem, no problem. There are people, I say, who do not have quite the same vision of security as we do. It is their right. Let me lay out before you here, mine, ours. There are people who do a lot of reels on this topic. The creation of 10,000 jobs, it is there, I made sure with the Mayor of Nantes, and moreover, President of Urban France, that the CSI, which she signed, not with me directly, but with the State, was well followed up. It's by chance Mr. Prefect, this week the planned reinforcements arrived. Alright, that's fine. That's good, but we're going to do it everywhere. Do not believe, we will do it everywhere. So you were convinced of this, but I'm telling you, if we are, as I said earlier, maneuvering with you on health security, if we are, as I was telling you time, with you, maneuvering on economic recovery and action against unemployment and poverty, I will not let anyone say that we are not maneuvering, in an extremely offensive way with our policy , in the field of action against all forms of insecurity and violence, starting with those perpetrated against women, since you know that in the statistics of violence, those perpetrated against women are those which have undergone the greatest progression. stronger. I could talk to you all afternoon, Madam President, and I know you will appreciate it immensely, I have no doubt, but the clock is ticking. But you see, I said it aside to Johanna ROLLAND, I obviously prepared myself, as always, my intervention with the support of my accomplice Jacqueline. I always try, towards you as towards the others, to have something to say to you because I know that it is not said to you in particular, the great flights, declarations of intention. I have known that, sometimes you have to do it. Maybe you yourself sometimes indulge in it. But, but the hour of the country is serious enough. All the same, we have in common, finally, to think that politics, you see, is something serious, that it is something necessary. More than ever, you see, we need collective action. More than ever, we need to be responsible, we need committed citizens. We can be against the sanitary pass. We do not have the absolute right to infect others. The Republic doesn't work that way, society doesn't work that way. And you are chosen on the ground, you know it every day. So I came before you once again, to tell you my total availability to continue this work of partnership, but above all to bring you not intentions of love, but proof, because it is much better. And finally, at a time when, I am perfectly aware of this, the trust of our fellow citizens – this is not new, I am not sure that I am the only outlet – the trust of our fellow citizens etiole, it is finally the only possible answer. Seek by all means the unity of the nation, work concretely, in sincerity, for their benefit, avoid demagogic postures and easy formulas, and provide proof of our collective effectiveness. And on that, whoever you are, I know I can count on you. Thank you very much.

topics_FR: Discours de Jean Castex, à la rencontre avec les ambassadeurs et les ambassadrices
speeches_FR: Monsieur le ministre, Monsieur le ministre délégué, Messieurs les secrétaires d’Etat, Monsieur le Secrétaire général, Mesdames et Messieurs les ambassadrices et ambassadeurs, Bien, monsieur le ministre de l'Europe et des Affaires étrangères, cher Jean-Yves, monsieur le ministre délégué, cher Franck, monsieur le secrétaire d'État, monsieur le Secrétaire général, mesdames et messieurs les directeurs, mesdames et messieurs les ambassadrices, les ambassadeurs, c'est un grand moment pour moi. Jamais je ne m'étais adressé — physiquement, d'abord, puis j'ai compris que beaucoup d'entre vous, hélas, crise sanitaire oblige, le sont virtuellement — à autant de hauts dignitaires du corps diplomatique. J'en suis très fier et très heureux comme je suis, mesdames et messieurs, sachez-le, très attaché aux traditions. Or, cette maison, car elle est étroitement liée à l'histoire de notre pays comme à celle de l'Europe, est faite de traditions. Celle qui veut que le Premier ministre intervienne, me semble-t-il, en clôture de la conférence des ambassadeurs et des ambassadrices et permettez-moi de l'exprimer ainsi une très belle et très utile tradition que la Covid, l'année dernière, était venue perturber. Une belle et utile tradition, mesdames et messieurs, dans un moment où le monde et notre pays affrontent des crises internationales, je le mesure bien d'une exceptionnelle gravité. Dimanche, j'étais à l'aéroport de Villacoublay avec la ministre des Armées. Jean-Yves LE DRIAN étant avec le président de la République pour accueillir l'avion qui ramenait en France les personnels de notre ambassade en Afghanistan et avec eux bien sûr notre ambassadeur David MARTINON ainsi que les forces de sécurité et les militaires qui assuraient leur protection et celle d'une partie de l'aéroport de Kaboul. L'action de nos personnels diplomatiques dans la gestion de cette tragédie ne pouvait mieux illustrer monsieur le ministre et cher Jean-Yves, la clairvoyance et le dévouement de votre belle administration en même temps qu'une capacité de mobilisation et une efficacité qui force le respect. Déjà, mardi dernier, ma rencontre avec les agents de la cellule de crise du Quai d'Orsay m'avait permis de constater, sans en être surpris, le sang-froid, la réactivité et en un mot, l'extrême professionnalisme des équipes, l'abnégation de nos diplomates comme de nos forces armées et des agents des autres administrations qui ont su trouver dans l'urgence des solutions tout en faisant preuve, on l'a vu, d'anticipations, d'humanité et de pragmatisme. Je dois dire que cette mobilisation remarquable, nous parlons de l'Afghanistan, avait caractérisé et caractérise d'autres terrains d'action où, hélas, les tensions et les situations de crise sont très fréquentes. Comme par exemple au Liban, dans le Haut Karabagh, au Sahel ou encore en Haïti. A chaque fois qu'une région du monde est soumise à une catastrophe humanitaire ou naturelle, dans les situations de conflit graves, notre diplomatie est aux avant-postes. C'est l'honneur de la France, c'est votre honneur, c'est l'honneur de votre mission. A ces crises internationales malheureusement récurrentes, est venue s'ajouter depuis 18 mois une pandémie mondiale aussi violente que longue, je ne peux l'évoquer sans penser d'emblée au précieux concours que nos postes particulièrement en Europe m’ont apporté lorsque la mission de préparer le premier, à l'époque, on ne le savait pas, déconfinement de notre pays, m’avait été confié par mon prédécesseur. Oui, je le dis ici, je le rappelle. On ne savait absolument pas ce qu'il fallait faire. Et en fait, c'est ce qu'on appelle « le benchmark », les comparaisons, les contacts via les postes diplomatiques que j'ai pu nouer avec mes homologues que peu ou prou la plupart des pays européens avaient désigné que en comparant nos pratiques, en confrontant nos expériences et nos situations, nous avons pu ensemble élaborer des pistes de sortie et les proposer au Conseil de défense et de sécurité nationale. Et depuis lors, vous n'avez cessé, comme je dois le dire, l'ensemble de l'Etat avec un E majuscule et de nos services publics, d'être sur le pont. Je tiens en particulier à saluer la mobilisation exceptionnelle qui a permis l'année dernière de rapatrier plus de 370 000 Français bloqués à l'étranger par l'épidémie. Toujours avec vous, vos équipes et l'administration consulaire, la France a pu accompagner socialement ceux de nos compatriotes installés à l'étranger qui ont été brutalement fragilisés par la crise sanitaire et organiser la vaccination dans quelque 60 pays où elle n'était toujours pas accessible. De même, le ministère s'est fortement investi cet été pour que nos compatriotes de passage en France, mais aussi les visiteurs étrangers, puissent se voir dans des conditions difficiles délivrer le passe sanitaire dès lors qu'ils étaient évidemment en mesure d'attester une vaccination homologuée. Bref, évidemment, la France de l'intérieur des frontières s'est mobilisée partout. J'ai une pensée pour les représentants de l'Etat dans les territoires d’outre-mer mais c'est toute l'administration française, tout le service public dans tous les pays du monde qui a été à la manœuvre et qui continue de l'être dans le cadre de cette pandémie. Cette crise mondiale et sa gestion sont venues au fond, nous rappeler l'importance du multilatéralisme et de l'approche coordonnée de l'action sanitaire. C'est aussi finalement des enseignements diplomatiques qu'il nous faut tirer de cette crise sanitaire. Je rappelle par exemple que la commande groupée de vaccins au niveau européen a permis d'élaborer une stratégie vaccinale efficace et de la déployer dans la durée et selon un plan concerté et ce qui apparaît au bout de quelques mois, il faut toujours se hâter là comme ailleurs, des jugements hâtifs. C'est que faire cavalier seul au milieu de cette tourmente n'est finalement pas une stratégie payante. Regardez les pays rares qui sont partis seuls devant. Maintenant, on voit qu'il y a une efficacité vaccinale qui s'émousse et ils se retrouvent confrontés à des difficultés. Les premiers seront les derniers ou les derniers, les premiers. En tout cas, ce qu'il faut dire, c'est qu'un microbe qui n'a pas de frontières, il faut là aussi une stratégie globale. Aujourd'hui, nous nous comparons avec les pays européens qui sont entrés dans cette procédure, alors par souci d'émulation à celui-ci. 75 % celui-ci en 74, celui-ci en 69. On se tient la vérité dans un mouchoir de poche même si je me plais devant vous à dire j'y reviendrai, que les performances de la France sont excellentes. Mais la réalité, c'est que nous devons avoir une approche globale de la gestion de cette crise et une approche européenne en particulier. Avec elle, d'ici quelques jours, l'objectif des 50 millions de primo vaccinés sera atteint dans notre pays. Nous pouvons être collectivement fiers d'une performance sanitaire qui nous place, je le rappelais, au premier rang des nations en matière de déploiement de la protection vaccinale. Mais je veux dire devant les ambassadrices, les ambassadeurs, que notre force et notre ambition ne doivent pas être seulement de gérer au mieux, de faire face, de soigner, de vacciner. Il nous appartient également de savoir très vite tirer toutes les conséquences structurelles, toutes les faiblesses que cette crise a mises en évidence. Nous le faisons. Ça s’appelle le Ségur de la santé. Je ne vous parlerais pas de ces volets humains. Mieux payer pour renforcer l’attractivité des professionnels de santé, notamment dans les établissements de santé. Je ne vous parlerais pas du volet bâtimentaire. C’est l’investissement dans les établissements de santé que nous allons déployer à partir de cet automne de manière massive. Je voudrais vous parler du volet de ce que nous appelons l'indépendance sanitaire. Qu’a fait apparaître cette crise ? Cette crise a bouleversé les chaînes d'approvisionnement des produits de santé, et a surtout montré les limites de la délocalisation d'un certain nombre de segments stratégiques de notre industrie de santé. Elle a mis en évidence des défaillances très anciennes du secteur de l'innovation en santé. Elle a souligné la nécessité d'accélérer la recherche médicale et surtout de soutenir l'augmentation des capacités de production sur le territoire français, et j'ajoute tout de suite, et européen, car vous savez ici que l'un et l'autre ne se séparent pas. A l'échelle nationale, nous avons déjà engagé cette reconquête d'indépendance avec le plan Innovation santé 2030 présenté par le président de la République fin juin et qui prévoit 7 milliards d'euros d'investissements dans ce domaine. Cela veut dire que nous allons relocaliser ou continuer à relocaliser les produits les plus critiques, à l'exemple de ce que nous avons fait pour le paracétamol. Pour cela, nous devons attirer vers nos industries, chercheurs et entrepreneurs, notamment dans les biotechs. Cela doit devenir un axe fort de notre attractivité économique, sujet transversal monsieur le ministre, et vous avez un rôle à jouer en la matière. Nous devons réinvestir dans le champ des biothérapies, de la santé numérique et des maladies émergentes. Et cette reconquête passe aussi par l'Europe. C'est la raison pour laquelle, vous le savez, nous avons proposé de lancer un PIIEC, un projet important d'intérêt européen pour soutenir l'innovation dans les industries de santé, réduire la dépendance de l'Union européenne par le développement de nos propres processus de production et donc de construire ou de reconstruire les outils industriels nécessaires pour répondre à nos besoins. Les discussions sont déjà engagées avec une douzaine d'Etats membres et nous devrions pouvoir lancer le projet au premier trimestre de 2022.
